uk.ac.ebi.pride.tools.mgf_parser

Class MgfFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.pride.tools.mgf_parser.MgfFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JMzReader

    public class MgfFile
extends java.lang.Object
implements JMzReader
    Represents a MgfFile.
    Author:
    jg

      MgfFile(java.io.File file, java.util.List<IndexElement> index)
      Creates the mgf file object from an existing mgf file with a pre-parsed index of ms2 spectra.

        public MgfFile(java.io.File file,
       boolean allowCustomTags)
        throws JMzReaderException
        Creates the mgf file object from an existing mgf file.
        Parameters:
        file - The mgf file
        allowCustomTags - Indicates if the parser should throw an exception when encountering non-standard tags
        Throws:
        JMzReaderException

      • MgfFile

        public MgfFile(java.io.File file,
       java.util.List<IndexElement> index)
        throws JMzReaderException
        Creates the mgf file object from an existing mgf file with a pre-parsed index of ms2 spectra. The index must hold the offsets of all "BEGIN IONS" lines in the order they appear in the file.
        Parameters:
        file - The mgf file
        index - An ArrayList holding the
        Throws:
        JMzReaderException

      • getIndexedSpectrum

        public static Spectrum getIndexedSpectrum(java.io.File sourcefile,
                          IndexElement indexElement)
                                   throws JMzReaderException
        Loads a (MS2) spectrum from an MGF file who's position in the file is already known.
        Parameters:
        sourcefile - The MGF file to load the spectrum from.
        indexElement - IndexElement specifying the position of the MS2 spectrum in the MGF file.
        Returns:
        The unmarshalled spectrum object.
        Throws:
        JMzReaderException

        public void setMs2Queries(java.util.List<Ms2Query> ms2Queries)

      • getMs2Query

        public Ms2Query getMs2Query(int nIndex)
                     throws JMzReaderException
        Returns the MS2 query with the given (0-based) index in the file. To get the number of queries call getMs2QueryCount().
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:

      • getIndex

        public java.util.List<IndexElement> getIndex()
        Returns the index of ms2 queries in the mgf file. This ArrayList contains the offsets of all "BEGIN IONS" lines until the end of the "END IONS" lines in the file in the order they are present.
        Returns:
        An array of "BEGIN IONS" lines offsets.

      • getSpectraIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSpectraIds()
        Description copied from interface: JMzReader
        Returns a list of Strings that hold the spectra's ids. The order of the returned ids resembls the order the spectra are returned in the spectra iterator. For formats that do not support ids such as dta or mgf the spectrum's 1-based index is used as id.
        Specified by:
        getSpectraIds in interface JMzReader
        Returns:

      • getSpectrumById

        public Spectrum getSpectrumById(java.lang.String id)
                         throws JMzReaderException
        Description copied from interface: JMzReader
        Returns the spectrum with the given id.
        Specified by:
        getSpectrumById in interface JMzReader
        Parameters:
        id - The spectrum's id.
        Returns:
        A Spectrum or null in case a spectrum with the given id doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        JMzReaderException

      • getSpectrumByIndex

        public Spectrum getSpectrumByIndex(int index)
                            throws JMzReaderException
        Description copied from interface: JMzReader
        Returns the spectrum based on its 1-based index in the file. In case the parser is parsing a directory the index will be translated to the filename's position in the directory (which can be random).
        Specified by:
        getSpectrumByIndex in interface JMzReader
        Parameters:
        index - The 1-based index of the spectrum in the file.
        Returns:
        A Spectrum or null in case a spectrum with the given index doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        JMzReaderException
